author: Constantino (Constante) Ribalaigua Vert
description: This drink is also known as a Papa Doble for good reason, it's twice the size of a regular cocktail. Hence the above recipe will fill one oversize Martini or two regular coupe glasses.If you've a bone dry palate and would like to sample a true Hemingway Special without the addition of sugar then try the following authentic recipe given to me by Alejandro Bolívar Rodriguez, Head Bartender at El Floridita, Havana, Cuba where this cocktail is blended and not shaken. Indeed, blending rather than shaking Daiquiris is the default at El Floridita.Daiquiri Hemingway (El Floridita's recipe)Glass: HurricaneGarnish: StrawMethod: BLEND all ingredients with crushed ice for five seconds.90ml (3oz) Light Cuban rum5ml (1 spoon) Maraschino liqueur30ml (1oz) Grapefruit juice15ml (½oz) Lime juice
name: Hemingway Special Daiquiri (Papa Doble)
recipeIngredient: 105 ml White/gold 1-3 year old mellow light rum
15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°brix)

recipeInstructions.text: SHAKE all ingredients with ice and fine strain into chilled glass
